4.1. Channel¶

class aleph.network.channel.Channel(owner_id, peer_id, peer_address)¶

Simple class representing an asynchronous communication channel through the network. Suitable for both a case when I am initiating connection (see open()) or when someone else does that (see connect()).

Parameters

  • owner_id (int) – process ID of the owner of the channel

  • peer_id (int) – process ID of the recipient (other end) of the channel

  • peer_address (tuple) – pair (IP, port) with peer’s address

async close()¶

Close the channel (unused for now).

connect(reader, writer)¶

Activate channel by connecting existing reader and writer to it.

is_active()¶

Guess what…

async open()¶

Activate the channel by opening a new connection to the peer.

async read()¶

Read data from the channel. If channel has not been activated yet, block and wait. If obtained REJECT message, raise RejectException.

static receive_handshake(reader, writer)¶

Receive handshake from an unknown process and find out their process_id.

async reject()¶

Send REJECT message.

send_handshake()¶

Introduce yourself (send process_id) to newly connected process.

async write(data)¶

Send data through the channel.

exception aleph.network.channel.RejectException¶
